'Mainu apne naal leja': Bizman dies trying to save family in Ludhiana; three security guards arrested
description: A 32-year-old businessman tragically died shielding his family during a wedding shootout in Ludhiana, where around 30 rounds were fired. The incident, described as a fight for supremacy between local criminals, resulted in two deaths, including the groom's aunt. Prime accused Shubham Arora remains at large, while Ankur has been arrested.

title: What are the US immigration restrictions ordered by Trump admin after shooting of National Guard members by Afghan national
IITs bar from placement drive 20+ companies that rescinded offers
description: Over 20 companies have been banned from participating in the IIT placement season for revoking job offers made to students, some as late as June or July. This decision was made unanimously by IITs to protect students' career prospects and mental well-being. The banned firms can still recruit through off-campus processes.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Chennai, suburbs wake to season’s wettest morning; schools, colleges closed
description: Cyclone Ditwah, after weakening, surprised Chennai with a deluge on Monday morning, causing widespread flooding and traffic disruptions. The India Meteorological Department issued orange and red alerts for the city and Tiruvallur respectively. Weathermen predict continued heavy rain for the region as the system lingers offshore.

title: Rate rejig: GST collection growth moderates in November
description: November GST collections saw modest growth after a significant rate overhaul, with the government highlighting increased consumption as a positive sign. While domestic revenue dipped slightly, import collections rose, and net collections improved due to lower refunds. Officials expressed optimism that these trends indicate a sustainable reform with a future multiplier effect.

Can give life convict bail during pendency of appeal if he has a fair chance of acquittal: SC
description: The Supreme Court has adopted a more lenient stance on bail for life convicts, stating that release is possible during appeal if acquittal appears likely. Applying this, a Tamil Nadu police officer convicted in a custodial death case was granted bail.

title: Winter Session of M.P. Assembly begins with protests over cough syrup tragedy, short duration of session
description: The four-day-long session began with members paying their condolences to various people, including film actor and former Lok Sabha MP Dharmendra, former Union Minister Shriprakash Jaiswal, and the victims of the explosion near Delhi’s Red Fort

description: 'Tere Ishk Mein' is performing impressively at the box office, maintaining strong collections despite a weekend dip. The romantic drama starring Dhanush and Kriti Sanon has garnered significant audience appreciation, evident in its steady footfalls across major cities and positive word-of-mouth. The film's success marks a new milestone for Dhanush, becoming his highest-earning Hindi venture.

title: Aquarius Horoscope Today, 02 December 2025: A difference of opinion could stir friction today
Sunjay Kapur property row: Not mentioned in will, mother Rani Kapur joins forces with Karisma Kapoor
description: A bitter inheritance battle has erupted over industrialist Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000-crore estate. His mother, Rani Kapur, has joined forces with his ex-wife Karisma Kapoor, challenging the validity of his will. They allege Sunjay's wife, Priya, is attempting to seize assets and question the will's authenticity, claiming it omits key family members and assets.

IND vs SA: Arshdeep reveals what Rohit said during his animated reaction after Kohli's ton - Watch
description: Virat Kohli's magnificent 52nd ODI century, a blistering 135, powered India to 349 against South Africa. A crucial partnership with Rohit Sharma underscored their enduring class.  While Kohli celebrated his 83rd international ton, Arshdeep Singh humorously revealed Rohit's quirky reaction.  Discussions about their 2027 World Cup future are ongoing, with potential domestic tournaments and BCCI meetings planned.

title: ‘I couldn’t take it’: Jemimah reveals why she deleted WhatsApp post-World Cup; cites privacy
description: Indian cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues deactivated WhatsApp after receiving a thousand messages post her semi-final heroics in the Women's World Cup.  Overwhelmed by the attention while preparing for the final, she disconnected from digital platforms to maintain focus. This highlights the immense public interest in women's cricket and the challenges athletes face managing newfound fame.

description: Vice President C.P. Radhakrishnan's first day as Rajya Sabha chairman saw a warm welcome from the treasury benches, led by PM Modi, praising his democratic rise. However, the opposition, led by Mallikarjun Kharge, clashed with the treasury, raising concerns about the previous chairman's sudden exit and demanding equal treatment for opposition voices.

description: The attack happened in Lakki Marwat, a district in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, a local police official said

title: Winter session: SIR debate demand wipes out Day 1; Rijiju rebuffs Opposition
description: Parliamentary proceedings were disrupted on the first day of the winter session as opposition parties demanded an immediate debate on the Election Commission's special intensive revision of electoral rolls. The government refused to commit to a timeline, leading to walkouts and adjournments. The opposition remains determined to force the issue, despite internal disagreements.

title: Bioterror serious concern, all nations must be ready: EAM Jaishankar
description: India's Foreign Minister S Jaishankar emphasized the urgent need for international cooperation to combat bioterrorism, warning that the misuse of biological weapons by non-State actors is a growing threat.

title: Italian tennis icon Nicola Pietrangeli dies aged 92
description: Born in Tunis in 1933 to an Italian father and Russian mother, Nicola Pietrangeli was widely considered the country’s greatest ever tennis player until the emergence of current world number two Jannik Sinner

title: Winter session: MP makes a statement with a stray, sets off a dogfight
description: Congress MP Renuka Chowdhury brought a rescued stray dog to Parliament, stating "Those sitting inside Parliament bite, dogs don't." She claimed the government dislikes animals. Union minister Ramdas Athawale retorted, "You keep bringing 'kutta' here and we will continue to get 'satta'." BJP MP Jagdambika Pal accused Chowdhury of "tamasha" and violating protocol.

title: ED notice to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, chief principal secretary KM Abraham
description: The ED has issued show-cause notices to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan, his chief principal secretary, and former finance minister in a Rs 467 crore FEMA violation case. The notices relate to KIIFB's alleged misuse of funds raised through masala bonds for land purchase, which is prohibited under RBI directives.

title: Joshna makes a strong startin HCL Squash Indian Tour 4
description: Joshna Chinappa will meet the seventh-seeded Kiwi Ella Jane Lash next

title: Govt orders handset makers to preload its Sanchar Saathi app
description: Smartphone manufacturers must now pre-install the government's Sanchar Saathi app on all devices sold in India. This mandate, effective within 90 days, aims to bolster cyber security and prevent IMEI tampering. However, privacy advocates express strong concerns, viewing it as an invasion of personal space and a potential threat to user data.

title: ‘Don’t want a slave’s peace’: Maduro hits back at Trump's 'leave Venezuela' threat; tensions escalate
description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro rejected a "slave's peace" amid escalating US pressure, accusing Washington of testing the nation with a prolonged naval deployment.  Reports suggest President Trump issued an ultimatum for Maduro to step down, which was reportedly refused. The US has intensified military pressure in the Caribbean, with strikes targeting suspected drug-carrying boats.

title: McLaughlin-Levrone, Duplantis win World Athlete of the Year titles
description: The international governing body for track and field announced the winners on November 30 at a ceremony in Monaco

title: Daily Horoscope Today, December 2, 2025: Comprehensive Astrological Predictions for Libra, Leo, Pisces, Aries and All Zodiac Signs
BJP demands audit of 1.25 crore entries made in SIR across three days in West Bengal
description: Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari claimed that between 26-28 November, digitisation figures of enumeration forms jumped from 5.5 crore to 6.75 crore, an abnormal and statistically impossible jump of 1.25 crore entries within just three days.

SC orders CBI probe into ‘digital arrest’ scam cases
description: The Supreme Court has ordered a pan-India CBI probe into digital arrest scams, granting the agency a free hand to investigate bankers involved in mule accounts. The court also directed coordination with Interpol and asked the RBI to explore AI for identifying suspicious bank accounts, while emphasizing the need for better SIM card issuance norms and state-level cybercrime coordination centers.

title: Winter may be chillier with more cold waves in parts of north: IMD
description: Central and parts of northwest and peninsular India brace for a colder winter with below-normal day and night temperatures expected from December to February. The region anticipates an increase of 4-5 additional cold wave days, potentially impacting vulnerable populations and transportation. Authorities are advised to maintain preparedness for these weather shifts.

title: SIR: UP headmaster dies of heart attack; toll rises to 8 in 10 days
description: Eight election workers have died in Uttar Pradesh during intensive revision duties in just ten days, including three suicides. A headmaster in Sambhal succumbed to a heart attack, with his family citing immense work pressure. Officials are facing scrutiny as teachers, often deployed due to manpower shortages, bear the brunt of demanding electoral tasks.

description: Army and Air Force, which already operate Heron Mk II drones, have placed additional orders while the Indian Navy is acquiring them for the first time, says official

title: Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion break the internet with new relationships
description: Rappers Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion are reportedly dating athletes Stefon Diggs and Klay Thompson. Fans are celebrating these pairings online. Cardi B is expecting a child with Stefon Diggs. Their relationships are seen as a positive development for the music stars. The public is embracing this crossover of hip-hop and sports.

title: The AIADMK is on a weak footing

title: White House says ‘very optimistic’ on chances of Ukraine deal

title: ‘Arbitrary and unfair’: Fadnavis slams SEC for postponing civic polls; calls it ‘legally wrong’
description: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis strongly condemned the State Election Commission's abrupt postponement of municipal council elections, deeming it arbitrary and legally flawed. He argued that such decisions unfairly impact candidates and set a dangerous precedent for election delays. The government will formally request the commission to reconsider its decision, citing significant injustice to voters and candidates.

title: Stefon Diggs injury update: Patriots WR expected to play vs Giants tonight
description: The New England Patriots are on a winning streak, with star wide receiver Stefon Diggs expected to play against the New York Giants tonight despite recent personal controversies. While Diggs faces lawsuits and drama involving Cardi B, his focus remains on the field. The team, currently strong, hopes for a successful season, with the game airing on ESPN.

title: Plea in Indore court seeks FIR against IAS Santosh Verma over controversial remarks
description: Shailendra Dwivedi, an Indore-based lawyer, filed a plea before the Judicial Magistrate First Class seeking directions for the police to register an FIR against IAS Santosh Verma while alleging that his statement was “vulgar, obscene and cheap”

Bill Belichick’s romantic moment with Jordon Hudson after UNC loss steals spotlight
description: Following a crushing UNC loss, Bill Belichick's gesture of giving his coat to girlfriend Jordon Hudson sparked a social media storm. While some saw a sweet, gentlemanly act, others criticized the timing and optics, especially given the team's performance and their relationship's public scrutiny. This small moment overshadowed the game's outcome, highlighting the intense focus on Belichick and Hudson.

title: Contribution of farm fires in Punjab, Haryana to pollution in Delhi-NCR ‘episodic’, says Centre

description: Arizona Cardinals' running back Trey Benson's return from knee surgery remains uncertain as Week 14 looms. Despite a brief practice, his continued absence fuels speculation about a setback. While the team is cautious, Week 15 is now the most probable target for his activation, with a December 10th deadline approaching.

title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor stripped of last remaining royal titles by UK’s King Charles
35 years on, CBI arrests Yasin aide wanted for Rubaiya abduction
description: A suspect, wanted for 35 years in the 1989 abduction of Rubaiya Sayeed, has been arrested by the CBI. Shafat Ahmed Shangloo, with a Rs 10 lakh bounty, allegedly conspired with jailed JKLF chief Yasin Malik. Rubaiya Sayeed identified Malik as one of her captors in court.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo status vs Wizards: Latest injury update
description: Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable to play against the Wizards, offering renewed optimism for the Milwaukee Bucks after a seven-game losing streak. His return, despite a left adductor strain, is crucial for the team's stability and momentum. Historically strong against Washington, his presence could significantly impact the game, even with managed minutes.

Brijesh Chowta, Dakshina Kannada MP, said in the Lok Sabha

title: Stephen Curry breaks silence on unseen moment with Ayesha days after controversy
description: Amidst online criticism regarding her past remarks about marriage and children, Stephen Curry shared a heartwarming golf memory with his wife, Ayesha. He recounted playing from the forward tees with her during a vacation, finding it enjoyable. This comes after Ayesha's comments on a podcast about not initially wanting marriage or kids.

Following Indian strikes, Pakistan shifted some launch pads deeper, but they remain under surveillance. Infiltration attempts have significantly dropped this year.

title: Third case this year: KIIT student dead in hostel; complaint alleges harassment
description: An 18-year-old student was discovered deceased in his hostel room in KIIT, prompting police to suspect suicide. This incident is the third of its kind this year. The grieving mother has pointed fingers at a girl from Chhattisgarh and her family for alleged harassment, which she believes contributed to her son taking the step.

The nation faces significant loss of life and widespread disruption.

description: Fugitive economic offenders owe Indian public sector banks over Rs 58,082 crore, including Rs 26,645 crore principal and Rs 31,437 crore interest as of October 2025. Fifteen individuals, including Vijay Mallya and Nirav Modi, have been declared Fugitive Economic Offenders, with nine linked to major bank frauds. Banks have recovered Rs 19,187 crore so far.

description: India has been invited to chair the International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance (International IDEA) for the first time, a recognition of its successful electoral process. Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar will assume the Chair on December 3, 2026, in Stockholm, Sweden. This appointment highlights India's significant experience in managing elections for its vast electorate.

title: 'We are in deep trouble': How US is lagging behind China - Ford CEO explains
description: Ford CEO Jim Farley warns of a critical shortage of skilled tradespeople in the US, highlighting over a million unfilled jobs and a dangerous lag compared to China. He stresses the need for investment in trade education and rebuilding the blue-collar workforce, citing Ford's own efforts to eliminate tiered wages as a step towards career stability.

description: The chilling case of a beheading of an Indian-origin man in Texas, which initially sparked presidential interest, has evolved dramatically. Yordanis Cobos-Martinez, the  accused, an undocumented immigrant from Cuba with a checkered past, will bypass death row and instead serve life in prison without the chance of parole.

S-400s, oil & RuPay-Mir: Modi–Putin summit tests India's tightrope between Russia, the West
description: As Russian President Vladimir Putin visits New Delhi, it will be his first visit to India since the Ukraine war began. As the two old partners Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Putin meet again, the news will be about missiles and credit cards, fighter jets, and oil flows. But the real story behind may be far more complicated.

title: Shedeur Sanders’ mom stuns in proud mama style with glam game-day look
description: Shedeur Sanders made his professional home debut for the Cleveland Browns, showcasing his potential despite a loss to the 49ers. Supported by his stylish mother, Pilar, who also garnered attention, Shedeur aims to solidify his starting quarterback role. Coach Stefanski praised his commitment, highlighting his growth after his first start.

title: Cardi B and Stefon Diggs look in love while celebrating his birthday on Instagram
description: Cardi B delighted fans by sharing glimpses of Stefon Diggs' birthday. A custom Snoopy football cake, celebrating his jersey number, stole the show. Later, a video captured the couple joyfully rapping and dancing in a car, radiating pure, unadulterated fun. This intimate peek into their celebration resonated deeply, earning them 'relationship goals' praise.

title: Oncologist reveals 4 surprising signs of cancer that most miss
description: Cancer can bring unexpected health challenges. Experts highlight four often-overlooked signs. These include pain after drinking alcohol, bone fractures from minor incidents, unusually high calcium levels, and changes in breast tissue or nipple discharge. Early detection through awareness of these symptoms is crucial for better outcomes. Consulting a doctor is advised if these signs appear. Read below to know more!

title: 7 red drinks that lower LDL cholesterol and boost heart health
description: Boost your heart health naturally by incorporating vibrant red drinks into your diet. Beverages like beetroot, pomegranate, and red grape juices, along with hibiscus and cranberry teas, are rich in antioxidants and flavonoids. These powerhouses help lower bad cholesterol, raise good cholesterol, and improve circulation, offering a delicious path to a healthier cardiovascular system.

title: Leon Draisaitl’s sharp message puts fresh spotlight on Connor McDavid’s leadership
description: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: From Apple to Microsoft: Bill Gates billion-dollar bet; How Gates bought Halo game maker
description: Microsoft's 2000 acquisition of Bungie Studios, spurred by a 1999 Macworld demo of Halo with Steve Jobs, secured a flagship franchise for the then-upcoming Xbox.  Initially a Mac-exclusive concept, Microsoft's timely offer rescued a struggling Bungie and transformed Halo into a system-defining, billion-dollar success that reshaped console gaming.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
description: Over a thousand Amazon employees have penned an open letter, warning that the company's rapid AI development is jeopardizing its climate commitments and human workforce.  They argue the pursuit of AI dominance is leading to increased emissions, water scarcity, and job displacement, urging leadership to prioritize ethical AI and environmental responsibility.
